DOC.brief_title: The Improving Care Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease Study A Cluster Randomized Trial
DOC.detailed_description: The care obstructive lung disease study ( CAROL ) cluster-randomized controlled trial randomization practice level . Thirty practice randomly assign equally sized intervention group control group . Each General Practioner ( GP ) practice approach consecutively regardless reason current encounter , COPD patient diagnose spirometric evaluation ( FEV1/ FVC < 0.70 ) , age 45 year old , smoke history = 10 pack-years ( PY ) . GPs intervention group receive `` QualiCCare '' education , address knowledge , decision-making behavioural aspect well delivery care accord COPD quality indicator evidence base key element . In control group educational intervention apply COPD patient treat usual . The study period one year . The primary outcome measure aggregate score relevant clinical process define element care patient COPD : smoking cessation counseling , influenza vaccination , motivation physical activity , appropriate pharmacotherapy , patient education collaborative care .
